6850485_syn_1:
Indication: Tracheal granulation/stenosis post-decannulation.
Procedure: Balloon dilation (31630).
- MAC, LMA.
- Mid-trachea stenosis 73%.
- CRE balloon: 12, 14, 16mm x 90s.
- Post: 20% residual.
- Mucosa intact.
Plan: D/C to recovery. Decadron 8mg.
6850485_syn_2:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Management of post-tracheostomy tracheal stenosis.
PATIENT: 48-year-old female recently decannulated.
FINDINGS: Circumferential fibrous scarring and granulation tissue at the prior stoma site in the mid-trachea, causing 73% obstruction.
PROCEDURE: A CRE balloon was advanced to the lesion. Sequential dilations were performed at 12mm, 14mm, and 16mm. 
RESULT: Restoration of airway patency to approximately 80% of normal. No significant mucosal injury observed.
6850485_syn_3:
CPT 31630: Bronchoscopy with tracheal dilation.
Diagnosis: Tracheal stenosis (Post-procedural).
Technique: Flexible bronchoscopy. Visualization of 73% mid-tracheal stenosis. CRE balloon dilation (12-16mm). Outcome: 80% patency achieved.

DIAGNOSIS: Tracheal narrowing after trach removal.
PROCEDURE: Scope with balloon expansion.
DETAILS: We found scar tissue in the middle of the windpipe. We used a radial balloon to stretch it open. We cycled through 12, 14, and 16mm. The airway is much wider now. No damage was seen. She is being sent home.
